snippet: The retailing giant holds its annual meeting Friday, celebrating 50 years in business but also having to deal with shareholder opposition to board members and some corporate policies.
abstract: Wal-Mart will hold its annual meeting, celebrating 50 years in business; it will have to deal with shareholder opposition to board members and some corporate policies; while no one expects shareholder discontent to provoke changes, analysts say the meeting will expose a measure of unhappiness among investors after revelations of a bribery scandal at the firm's Mexican subsidiary.
lead_paragraph: The retailing giant holds its annual meeting Friday, celebrating 50 years in business but also having to deal with shareholder opposition to board members and some corporate policies.

headline.seo: At Annual Meeting, Wal-Mart to Confront Shareholder Unrest
headline.main: At Annual Meeting, Wal-Mart to Confront Shareholder Unrest
headline.print_headline: Amid Celebration, Walmart to Face Its Restive Shareholders
